Description: Ovoid marl pottery jar with small flat base, two pierced cylindrical handles on the shoulder and a ledge rim; decorated in red paint with one large so-called Naqada plant on each side with s-motifs and wavy lines below. Wavy lines are painted above and over the handles; below the handles on each side is a fan-like bush motif.
Curator's comments: Like Decorated ware D36a in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921). Published: G. Graff, Les peintures sur vases de Naqada I–Naqada II: Nouvelle approche sémiologique de l’iconographie prédynastique, Leuven (2009), cat. no. 451.
